docs.title: Fudge
docs.text: This is a cross-platform open-source alternative to Fujifilm's official camera app.

docs.title: Improvements over XApp / Camera Connect
docs.text:
• Location and notification permissions are not required
  • Much more responsive native UI
  • Performance improvements
  • USB-OTG connectivity support
  • Lua plugins API

This app isn't finished yet, so don't set high expectations. Fuji's version of PTP/IP has many different quirks and features, so it's not easy to implement them all from a single camera. Currently, it's only been tested on a few older cameras, but functionality for newer cameras will slowly be implemented (as well as bluetooth) over time.

Beta builds are published on Google Play. The latest builds are also available on F-Droid.

docs.title: Roadmap
docs.text:
• Stable PTP/IP communication with camera over WiFi
  • Tested & working on X-A2, X-H1
  • Tested & working on a few virtual cameras
  • Gallery of images
  • Zoomable image viewer, download/share photos
  • Implement "select multiple / single" mode
  • Implement PTP/USB OTG support
  • Lua scripting
  • AutoSave and tether mode
  • Mass photo import (different folder for each camera?)
  • Camera properties (ISO, white balance, film sim, etc)
  • Implement Bluetooth communication (use cross-platform lib? Rust?)
  • Liveview & Remote capture
  • Desktop app/utility
  • iOS port (see ios/)
  • Delete images?
  • Translate UI
  • Support landscape mode

docs.title: Help
docs.text:
To be clear, the following is not supported yet:

  • Bluetooth
  • Liveview
  • Geotagging

docs.title: Finding the wireless menu
docs.text:
• Look for 'WIRELESS TRANSFER' or 'WIRELESS COMMUNICATION' in 'PLAYBACK MENU'
  • On some cameras, the 'Fn' button opens up the WiFi menu by default

docs.title: Pairing over WiFi
docs.text:
Older cameras will have these options:

VIEW & OBTAIN IMAGES ON (phone)
SEND INDIVIDUAL IMAGES
SEND SELECTED MULTIPLE IMAGES

When you press a connection mode, you will get a screen like this:

   SEARCHING
FUJIFILM-X-A2-5DBC
SELECT Browse Camera
ON (phone) FUJIFILM APP
(OK) CHANGE   (BACK) CANCEL

If you are connecting for the first time, press (OK) CHANGE.

On your device, open WiFi settings and manually connect to the access point (aka hotspot) your camera is exposing. It will start with FUJIFILM. Once you connect, you might need to confirm the connection in certain versions of Android.

docs.title: PC AutoSave
docs.text:
• 'SET-UP' -> 'PC AUTO SAVE SETTING'
  • 'CONNECTION SETTING' -> 'PC AUTO SAVE' -> 'PC AUTO SAVE SETTING'

'SIMPLE SETUP' Press the WPS button on your router for 3 seconds and wait until your camera confirms a connection.

'MANUAL SETUP' Select your WiFi network and punch in password on the camera.
